org.ejvm.util

Class ArrayUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ejvm.util.ArrayUtil

  • public class ArrayUtil
extends Object

    Utility class for array handling.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Sebastian Nicolai Kaupe

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ArrayUtil() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <T> boolean contains(T[] arr, T e)
      Checks if an element equal to e can be found in arr.
      static <T> int indexOf(T[] arr, T e)
      Returns the first index of the element of arr that is equal to e, with equality being determined by the equals()-Method of T.
      static <T> int indexOf(T[] arr, T e, Comparator<T> comparator)
      Returns the first index of the element of arr for which comparator.compareTo(arr[i], e) == 0 evaluates to true, with i ranging from 0 to arr.length.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        public ArrayUtil()

    • Method Detail

      • indexOf

        public static <T> int indexOf(T[] arr,
              T e)

        Returns the first index of the element of arr that is equal to e, with equality being determined by the equals()-Method of T.

        Parameters:
        arr - The array to search through.
        e - The comparison element.
        Returns:
        The index of the first element that fulfills the requirements or -1 if no such element was found.

      • indexOf

        public static <T> int indexOf(T[] arr,
              T e,
              Comparator<T> comparator)

        Returns the first index of the element of arr for which comparator.compareTo(arr[i], e) == 0 evaluates to true, with i ranging from 0 to arr.length.

        Parameters:
        arr - The array to search through.
        e - The comparison element.
        comparator - The Comparator used to compare the array elements to e.
        Returns:
        The index of the first element that fulfills the requirements or -1 if no such element was found.

      • contains

        public static <T> boolean contains(T[] arr,
                   T e)

        Checks if an element equal to e can be found in arr.

        Parameters:
        arr - The array to search through.
        e - The searched-for element.
        Returns:
        true if the array contains an element equal to e, otherwise false.
